Intervention.evidence: Thirteen patients with advanced PD underwent bilateral stereotactic implantation of CB cell aggregates into the striatum.

Objective.evidence: Objective: We conducted a phase I–II clinical study to assess the feasibility, long term safety, clinical and neurochemical effects of intrastriatal CB autotransplantation in patients with PD.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome measure was the change in video blinded Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale III score in the off‐medication state.

Blinding.evidence: video blinded Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale III score

Number_Randomised.evidence: Thirteen patients with advanced PD underwent bilateral stereotactic implantation

Number_Analysed.evidence: Clinical amelioration in the primary outcome measure was observed in 10 of 12 blindly analysed patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: Overall, mean improvement at 6 months was 23%.

Harms.evidence: None of the patients developed off‐period dyskinesias.
